The photo used in the claim was original: an online stock photography database, and is not related to the alleged incident in Vellore district.
The misleading post on Facebook included: language caption that falsely claimed Muslims in Vellore district violated the COVID-19 lockdown to pray at 1 am.
The photo in question was taken on May 1: 2018, during Ramadan in Allahabad (now known as Prayagraj) in the state of Uttar Pradesh, according to Alamy's caption.
The ongoing nationwide COVID: 19 lockdown in India has been extended multiple times and is set to remain in place until at least May 17, 2020, making the claim of Muslims violating the lockdown to pray in Vellore district false.
